name: Covid 19 Patient Data 2023
title: Covid 19 Patient Data 2023

api_list.name: /totalTestsAdministeredCumulativeSince3232020
api_list.description: The endpoint 'totalTestsAdministeredCumulativeSince3232020' from the API 'Covid19PatientData2023' provides information about the total number of tests administered for COVID-19 since March 23, 2020. This endpoint returns an array of strings that includes all possible values for this field. By accessing this endpoint, users can retrieve cumulative data on the number of COVID-19 tests carried out since the specified date. This data is essential to track the scale and progression of testing efforts over time. It enables researchers, policymakers, and healthcare professionals to analyze the testing trends and understand the impact of testing on the overall management of the pandemic. This endpoint holds valuable information for assessing testing capabilities, monitoring testing strategies, and evaluating the effectiveness of interventions.

api_list.name: /dateOfLatestDeath
api_list.description: The endpoint 'dateOfLatestDeath' from the API 'Covid19PatientData2023' provides an array of strings representing the possible values for the field 'dateOfLatestDeath'. This field captures the date when a patient who has been affected by COVID-19 last passed away. This endpoint is valuable for obtaining information about the dates of the latest recorded deaths related to COVID-19. By exploring the array of strings returned by this endpoint, users can identify and analyze patterns in the progression of the pandemic over time. They can evaluate the impact of the virus on different communities, regions, or countries based on the frequency or distribution of dates in the array.This data could be beneficial for researchers, healthcare professionals, and policy makers to understand the timeline and magnitude of the pandemic's impact. It could help in making informed decisions regarding public health strategies, resource allocation, and healthcare planning to effectively combat the ongoing crisis.

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint is a part of the Covid19PatientData2023 API that provides a list of possible values for the field 'dataListIndex'. This endpoint returns an array of strings containing these values. The 'dataListIndex' field is used to categorize the data related to Covid-19 patients. Each value in the array represents a specific category or index. By utilizing this endpoint, you can retrieve a comprehensive list of all the available categories or indices that can be associated with the data.For instance, if the API provides data on Covid-19 patients based on different age groups, the 'dataListIndex' array might contain values like '0-18', '19-30', '31-45', and so on. These values essentially help in organizing the data based on common characteristics or attributes.By making use of the 'dataListIndex' endpoint, developers can fetch the entire array of possible values for 'dataListIndex'. This information can be helpful for data analysis, data filtering, or any other application that requires understanding the different categories or indices associated with the Covid-19 patient data.

api_list.name: /facility
api_list.description: The 'facility' endpoint in the Covid19PatientData2023 API provides a list of facilities related to Covid-19 patient data. These facilities represent the locations where patients have received or are receiving medical care or treatment. Each facility is represented as a string, providing useful information about the place. By accessing this endpoint, you can retrieve an array of strings that represent all possible values for the 'facility' field. These values can range from hospitals, clinics, or specific healthcare institutions that handle Covid-19 cases. The array may contain various unique facility names, allowing you to gain insights into the different healthcare settings involved in treating Covid-19 patients.By utilizing this user-friendly endpoint, developers or researchers can analyze the distribution of Covid-19 patients across different facilities, identify patterns, or even evaluate the capacity of specific healthcare centers. This information can aid in understanding the healthcare infrastructure and resource allocation for combating the pandemic effectively.

api_list.name: /positiveCumulativeSince5162020
api_list.description: The 'positiveCumulativeSince5162020' endpoint in the 'Covid19PatientData2023' API provides an array of strings that represent the cumulative number of positive cases since May 16, 2020. Each string in the array represents a possible value for the 'positiveCumulativeSince5162020' field. This endpoint is useful for obtaining a historical perspective on the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases over a period of time. By examining the different values in the array, one can observe the progression and growth of positive cases since May 16, 2020. The values returned by this endpoint could be in various formats, such as numerical representations or formatted dates, depending on the API implementation. Researchers, health professionals, and data analysts can leverage this information to analyze trends, track the impact of interventions, and monitor the spread of the virus over time.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint is the primary feature of the API 'Covid19PatientData2023' that provides valuable information about patients affected by Covid-19. When you access this endpoint, it returns an array of objects that contain rows of data associated with the query parameters you specify.By using this endpoint, you can gain insights into various aspects of Covid-19 patient data such as demographics, symptoms, geographical locations, and more. Each object in the array represents a specific patient record and holds relevant information about their condition.The 'records' endpoint enables users to easily filter and search for specific patient records based on their requirements or criteria. This can be helpful for researchers, healthcare professionals, or anyone interested in understanding the impact of the pandemic on patients.Whether you want to study trends, gather statistics, or analyze patterns, the 'records' endpoint empowers users to explore and extract meaningful information from the vast dataset available. It serves as a valuable tool for gaining a comprehensive understanding of the Covid-19 patient landscape and aids in evidence-based decision-making.

api_list.name: /deathWhilePositiveCumulativeSince05302020
api_list.description: The endpoint 'deathWhilePositiveCumulativeSince05302020' from the API 'Covid19PatientData2023' allows users to retrieve an array of strings representing all the possible values for the field 'deathWhilePositiveCumulativeSince05302020'. This field corresponds to the cumulative number of deaths recorded in individuals who tested positive for COVID-19 since May 30, 2020. By accessing this endpoint, users can obtain an overview of the cumulative death toll linked to COVID-19 cases, providing valuable insights into the impact of the virus over time. The array of strings returned showcases various values representing the cumulative deaths, offering quantitative data to analyze and monitor the severity and progression of the pandemic. These values may include numbers denoting the cumulative death count or other relevant information related to COVID-19 fatalities.Utilizing this user-friendly endpoint, developers, researchers, and individuals interested in understanding the overall impact of COVID-19 can gain access to crucial data on the cumulative deaths associated with positive COVID-19 cases since May 30, 2020.

api_list.name: /averagePositivesPerDay
api_list.description: TheaveragePositivesPerDay' endpoint from the 'Covid19PatientData2023' API provides an array of strings representing various values for the field 'averagePositivesPerDay'. This field signifies the average number of positive COVID-19 cases recorded per day. By accessing this endpoint, you can obtain valuable information regarding the average rate at which new cases are being identified over a specific period. This data can be helpful in understanding the spread of the virus and the effectiveness of preventive measures implemented.For instance, the array of strings returned from this endpoint may include values such as 'Low', 'Moderate', 'High', or even specific numerical ranges like '10-20', '50-100', etc. These values help categorize and quantify the infection rate, allowing policymakers, researchers, and the general public to assess the severity of the pandemic and make informed decisions accordingly.Utilizing the 'averagePositivesPerDay' endpoint enables users to gain insights into the average daily COVID-19 positives, aiding in monitoring, analyzing, and responding to the ongoing situation effectively.

api_list.name: /positivePercentagePerTest
api_list.description: The `positivePercentagePerTest` endpoint in the API 'Covid19PatientData2023' provides valuable information about the positive percentage of COVID-19 tests conducted. It returns an array of strings containing all possible values for the field 'positivePercentagePerTest'. The 'positivePercentagePerTest' represents the proportion of COVID-19 tests that resulted in a positive diagnosis. This metric helps in understanding the prevalence and spread of the virus within a specific population or region. The values returned can vary and could include percentages such as 5%, 10%, 15%, and so on, reflecting the percentage of positive cases per total number of tests conducted.Monitoring the positive percentage per test is crucial in tracking the effectiveness of diagnostic efforts and the overall containment strategies implemented. Increasing or decreasing trends in this metric can indicate the trajectory of the virus and guide public health interventions accordingly. Health officials, researchers, and the public can utilize this information to assess the severity of the pandemic, evaluate the efficacy of testing protocols, and make informed decisions about mitigation measures.

api_list.name: /averageDeathsPerDay
api_list.description: The 'averageDeathsPerDay' endpoint in the 'Covid19PatientData2023' API provides an array of strings that represents the possible values for the field 'averageDeathsPerDay'. This field denotes the average number of deaths per day due to COVID-19. The endpoint enables users to access a comprehensive range of these average values.By utilizing this endpoint, developers can extract information concerning the intensity of COVID-19's impact in different regions or periods. The array of strings represents the various average death rates, which can be used to assess the severity of the pandemic in specific locations or over specific time intervals.This endpoint allows users to process and analyze the average death rates effectively, enabling them to gain insights into the magnitude of the pandemic and make informed decisions regarding public health measures, resource allocation, or tracking the progress of virus containment efforts.Overall, the 'averageDeathsPerDay' endpoint serves as a vital resource within the 'Covid19PatientData2023' API, delivering essential information in a user-friendly format for combating the coronavirus crisis.

api_list.name: /averageTestsPerDay
api_list.description: The 'averageTestsPerDay' endpoint from the API 'Covid19PatientData2023' provides a user-friendly way to retrieve a range of possible values for the field 'averageTestsPerDay'. This field represents the average number of COVID-19 tests conducted per day in a given area or population group. By making a request to this endpoint, we can obtain an array of strings containing various values that represent average tests per day.For example, the array might include strings like '50 tests per day', '100 tests per day', '150 tests per day', and so on. These values give us a sense of the testing capacity or intensity of COVID-19 testing in different regions or communities. The endpoint allows us to gather this information and understand the frequency of testing efforts, which can provide insights into the level of proactive measures taken to control the spread of the virus.

api_list.name: /dateOfLatestPositiveCase
api_list.description: The endpoint 'dateOfLatestPositiveCase' from the API 'Covid19PatientData2023' provides a user-friendly way to retrieve a list of dates representing the latest positive cases for Covid-19 patients. This information is crucial for tracking the progression of the virus.The endpoint returns an array of strings, where each string represents a specific date when a Covid-19 patient tested positive. The dates are formatted in a standardized manner, making it easy for users to understand and interpret the data. By using this endpoint, you can gather all the possible values for the field 'dateOfLatestPositiveCase'. This enables you to analyze the frequency and pattern of positive cases over time, helping health authorities and researchers gain insights into the spread of the virus and its impact on different regions or demographics.Note: The specific examples provided previously are not included as they were just for illustration purposes.

api_list.name: /newlyPositiveInTheLast14Days
api_list.description: The endpoint 'newlyPositiveInTheLast14Days' from the API 'Covid19PatientData2023' provides an array of strings that represents the possible values for the field 'newlyPositiveInTheLast14Days'. This field reflects the recent COVID-19 testing results for individuals and indicates whether they have tested positive for the virus in the last 14 days. The array of strings includes various values that could indicate different scenarios related to newly positive cases within the specified time frame. By accessing this endpoint, you can retrieve crucial information about the recent COVID-19 infections and track the spread of the virus more effectively. However, please note that the specific examples of values for this field have not been mentioned here, as they should be referenced directly from the API documentation or response data.

api_list.name: /facilityPositivePercentage
api_list.description: The 'facilityPositivePercentage' endpoint from the 'Covid19PatientData2023' API provides a range of values in string format for the field 'facilityPositivePercentage'. This field represents the percentage of individuals who tested positive for the COVID-19 virus within the healthcare facilities or hospitals. By utilizing this endpoint, users can retrieve various possible values indicating different levels of positive cases within healthcare settings. These values are associated with the ratio of infected patients to the total number of individuals tested in the specific facility. The endpoint returns an array, which is a list of strings, suggesting the diverse range of percentages.This information is valuable for analyzing the impact of the virus on healthcare facilities and monitoring the spread within these critical environments. Researchers, public health officials, and policymakers can utilize the 'facilityPositivePercentage' endpoint to assess the effectiveness of infection control measures, allocate resources, and make informed decisions to curb the transmission of COVID-19 within healthcare settings.
